He earned a higher salary compared to his time with the Patriots, reflecting his increased responsibilities as a backup quarterback. He also experienced a brief stint with the Pittsburgh Steelers, further enhancing his earning potential.

  • 2013-2014:A pivotal moment in Hoyer’s career came with his move to the Cleveland Browns. He took on the role of the starting quarterback, leading the team to a surprising 7-4 record.   • 2017-2021:Hoyer returned to the New England Patriots, his original team, for a second stint. His experience and leadership were valuable assets to the team, earning him a respectable salary as a backup quarterback.
